answers.answer: I, too have coughed since October of 2010.  At first I went through a round of bronchitis and pneumonia.  I have lupus and type 1 diabetes.  Since it takes me longer to heal my doctor just kept giving me antibiotics. After that, she suggested I see a pulmonologist.  He did a chest x-ray and tested me for whooping cough (pertussis).  He then decided that it was probably allergies or asthma and gave me nose spray, steroids for a week and an inhaler.  Nothing worked.  I finally went to an ENT who scoped my throat this morning and he discovered that my TONSILS were huge!  I am back on steroids and Augmentin (antibiotic) for 10 days. The cough was just so bad and got to the point of gagging.  So, my advice would be to keep looking for the problem.  If this doesn't work, I'm back to the doctor...I just have to stop coughing!  I hope this helps....
